info.description:
A lightweight relay service for managing TR-069 devices via GenieACS.
Provides endpoints for SSID/WLAN management, device capability detection, and DHCP clients.
info.title: GenieACS Relay API

post.description: Clears the device cache. Can clear cache for a specific device or all devices.

parameters.description: Device ID to clear cache for (omit to clear all)
parameters.name: device_id

get.description: Retrieves the wireless capability of a device (single-band or dual-band) based on ONU model detection
Retrieves DHCP client information (connected devices) for a device identified by its IP address
Retrieves WLAN/SSID information, automatically triggering a refresh if data is not available and retrying until data is found or timeout
Returns the health status of the service. Does not require authentication.
Retrieves WLAN/SSID configuration for a device identified by its IP address

post.description: Triggers a refresh of WLAN configuration data for a device. The refresh is processed asynchronously.

get.description: Returns available WLAN slots for creating new WiFi networks based on device capability

post.description: Creates a new WLAN on an available slot with advanced configuration options

delete.description: Disables an existing WLAN configuration. This effectively "deletes" the WLAN by disabling it.

put.description: Optimizes WLAN radio settings including channel, mode, bandwidth, and transmit power. Supports partial updates.
Updates an existing WLAN configuration. Supports partial updates - only include fields you want to change.

auth_mode.description: Authentication mode: Open, WPA, WPA2, WPA/WPA2

password.description: Password for the new WLAN (required for WPA/WPA2)

ip.description: IP address assigned to the client

mac.description: MAC address of the client device

mode.description: WiFi standard mode (b, g, n, b/g, g/n, b/g/n for 2.4GHz; a, n, ac, a/n, a/n/ac for 5GHz)

main.SSIDForceResponse.description: Force SSID response with retry information

ssid.description: Network name broadcast by the WLAN

ApiKeyAuth.description: API key for authentication (required when MIDDLEWARE_AUTH=true)
ApiKeyAuth.name: X-API-Key
